summary: This bill, the Regulations Evaluated to Determine The Anticipated Price and Effect Act (RED TAPE Act), prohibits federal agencies from considering non-monetized or unquantified factors in regulatory impact and benefit-cost analyses. It mandates agencies to prioritize quantifiable financial benefits and requires public disclosure of these analyses, including methodologies. The bill also grants judicial review for challenges to rules violating this prohibition and directs the Office of Management and Budget to issue guidance for compliance.
